bio: Gordon Ramsay is a British chef, restaurateur, and television personality. He has owned and operated a number of restaurants across the world and has won numerous awards for his culinary expertise.

recipes.name: Spicy Korean Fried Chicken
recipes.method:
Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. In a large bowl, mix together flour, salt, black pepper, garlic powder, paprika, and cayenne pepper.
3. Add chicken wings to the bowl and toss to coat with the flour mixture.
4. Place chicken wings on the baking sheet and bake for 25-30 minutes, until golden brown and cooked through.
5. While the chicken is baking, make the sauce. In a small saucepan, mix together gochujang sauce, honey, soy sauce, garlic, and ginger. Cook over low heat for 5 minutes

recipes.name: Spinach and Ricotta Stuffed Shells
ingredients: 1/2 cup frozen spinach, thawed and drained
recipes.method: Preheat oven to 375°F. Cook the jumbo pasta shells according to package instructions. In a large bowl, mix together ricotta cheese, parmesan cheese, egg, spinach, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper. Stuff the cooked shells with the cheese mixture and place them in a baking dish. Pour marinara sauce over the stuffed shells and top with shredded mozzarella cheese. Cover with foil and bake for 25-30 minutes. Remove the foil and bake for an additional 5-10 minutes, until the cheese is melted and bubbly.

recipes.name: Teriyaki Glazed Salmon
recipes.method: Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. In a small saucepan, mix together soy sauce, honey, rice vinegar, garlic powder, and ginger powder. Cook over low heat for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.Pour marinara sauce over the stuffed shells and top with shredded mozzarella cheese. Cover with foil and bake for 25-30 minutes. Remove the foil and bake for an additional 5-10 minutes, until the cheese is melted and bubbly.

bio: Julia Child was an American chef, author, and television personality. She is credited with bringing French cuisine to the American public with her cookbook, Mastering the Art of French Cooking, and her popular cooking show

recipes.name: Mushroom and Truffle Risotto
recipes.method:
In a large pot, heat the broth over medium heat and keep it warm. In a separate large pot, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the mushrooms and cook until they release their liquid and begin to brown, about 8 minutes. Add the Arborio rice and stir to coat in the butter and mushroom mixture. Add the white wine and stir until it is absorbed by the rice.
6. Begin adding the warm broth to the rice, about 1 cup at a time, stirring frequently and allowing the rice to absorb the broth before adding more.

recipes.name: Spicy Grilled Shrimp Tacos
ingredients: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
recipes.method: Preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat. In a medium bowl, combine the shrimp, olive oil, chili powder, cumin, smoked paprika, cayenne pepper, garlic powder, and salt. Toss to coat the shrimp. Grill the shrimp for 2-3 minutes per side, or until cooked through. Warm the tortillas on the grill or in a dry skillet over medium heat. Assemble the tacos by placing 2-3 shrimp on each tortilla, along with some shredded red cabbage, avocado slices, and chopped cilantro.

recipes.name: Honey Mustard Glazed Salmon
recipes.method: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. In a small bowl, whisk together the honey, Dijon mustard, whole grain mustard, olive oil, garlic, and dried thyme. Season the salmon fillets with salt and pepper, and place them skin-side down on the prepared baking sheet. Brush the honey mustard glaze over the top of each fillet, covering it evenly. Bake the salmon for 12-15 minutes
